mlneuro.crossvalidation¶

Cross-validation objects allowing automatic generation of stacked cross-validators, noisy data masking, and cross-validation for binned regression

class mlneuro.crossvalidation.MaskedTrainingCV(base_cv, train_mask, cv_returns_idxs=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Meta cross validator that applies a mask to the training set to limit the training to instances that are meaningful but still tests on all values

get_n_splits(X=None, y=None, groups=None)[source]¶
split(X, y=None, groups=None)[source]¶
class mlneuro.crossvalidation.TrainOnSubsetCV(base_cv, train_size=0.5, max_size=inf, min_size=0, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Meta cross validator that limits the size of the training set to a fractional amount with upper and lower limits

get_n_splits(X=None, y=None, groups=None)[source]¶
split(X, y=None, groups=None)[source]¶
mlneuro.crossvalidation.cross_val_predict(estimator, X, y=None, groups=None, cv=None, n_jobs=1, verbose=0, fit_params=None, pre_dispatch='2*n_jobs', method='predict')[source]¶

Please see sklearn for documenation This has only been modified so binned regressors can return probabilites

mlneuro.crossvalidation.generate_crossvalidator(estimator, X, y=None, n_splits=3, base=None, training_mask=None, limit_training_size=None)[source]¶

Create a cross-validation object which splits data into training and test sets. This is a general function which simplifies the chaining of several cross-validator objects to extend the base cross-validators available in sklearn.

Output crossvalidators:
KFold or StratifiedKFold if regression or classification is being done respectively TrainOnSubsetCV if the training size is to be reduced for each fold MaskedTrainingCV if the training set has noise in it that shouldn’t be used MultisignalCV if X is a list or tuple and needs each list-item to be split separately
